Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder-section of a red/brown ribbed pottery vessel, with slight traces of a black resinous deposit on the interior, exterior covered with a self-slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now worn away in places.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.185)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36434) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36434)
